logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: The case for mixed-ability classes

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The case for mixed-ability classes

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các lớp học có nhiều trình độ khác nhau

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Classes in which students have a wide range of different academic capabilities.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các lớp học đa trình độ

phase3Production.content: Teaching mixed-ability classes can be challenging, but it also offers opportunities for peer learning.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: For three students, even these literary demands are beyond them.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những yêu cầu về mặt văn học

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The level of skill and understanding required to comprehend a piece of literature.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những yêu cầu về mặt văn học

phase3Production.content: The literary demands of a Shakespearean play are significantly higher than those of a modern novel.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He can ask the No Fear group to identify the key characters and provide a tentative plot summary.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tóm tắt cốt truyện sơ bộ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A provisional or preliminary summary of the main events of a story.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tóm tắt cốt truyện sơ bộ

phase3Production.content: Before writing the full report, she submitted a tentative plot summary to her editor for approval.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He can ask most of the class about character development, and five of them might be able to support their statements with textual evidence.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Evidence gathered from the original source or text that supports an argument or thesis.

phase3Production.content: Every essay must include specific textual evidence to support its claims.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: advocates living a life of moderation
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Now two curious students are wondering whether Shakespeare advocates living a life of moderation or one of passionate engagement.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ủng hộ một cuộc sống điều độ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To publicly support or recommend a lifestyle that avoids extremes of behavior or expression.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ủng hộ một cuộc sống điều độ

phase3Production.content: The philosopher advocates living a life of moderation, finding happiness in balance rather than excess.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...or one of passionate engagement.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự dấn thân đầy nhiệt huyết

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The act of being involved with something in a way that shows strong feelings or beliefs.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự dấn thân đầy nhiệt huyết

phase3Production.content: Her success is a result of her passionate engagement with environmental issues.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and all the students who want to discuss the virtue of moderation into another?

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đức tính của sự điều độ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being reasonable and avoiding extremes, considered as a form of moral excellence.

phase3Production.content: Ancient Greek philosophers often wrote about the virtue of moderation in all things.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The practice of ‘streaming’, or ‘tracking’, involves separating students into classes depending on their diagnosed levels of attainment.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The educational practice of grouping students for all subjects according to their general academic ability.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phân luồng hoặc xếp lớp (theo trình độ)

phase3Production.content: The debate over the benefits and drawbacks of streaming in schools is ongoing.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...depending on their diagnosed levels of attainment.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mức độ thành tích được chẩn đoán

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The academic standards that students have been formally assessed to have reached.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mức độ thành tích được chẩn đoán

phase3Production.content: Students were placed into different math groups based on their diagnosed levels of attainment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: At a macro level, it requires the establishment of academically selective schools for the brightest students, and comprehensive schools for the rest.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: On a large scale; considering the overall picture rather than small details.

phase3Production.content: At a macro level, the country's economy is growing, but many individuals are still struggling.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it requires the establishment of academically selective schools for the brightest students...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Schools that admit students on the basis of some sort of selection criteria, usually academic achievement.

phase3Production.content: Entrance exams for academically selective schools are often highly competitive.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The practice is intuitively appealing to almost every stakeholder.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hấp dẫn một cách trực giác

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Appealing to someone based on feelings or instincts rather than conscious reasoning.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hấp dẫn một cách trực giác

phase3Production.content: The idea of a four-day work week is intuitively appealing to most employees.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: I have heard the mixed-ability model attacked by way of analogy: a group hike.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Using a comparison between two things, typically for the purpose of explanation or clarification.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bằng cách ví von/so sánh tương tự

noun.meaning: phép loại suy, sự tương tự

phase3Production.content: He explained the concept of electricity by way of analogy, comparing it to water flowing through a pipe.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The fittest in the group take the lead and set a brisk pace.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đặt ra một nhịp độ nhanh

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To establish a quick and energetic speed of movement or activity.

phase3Production.content: The tour guide set a brisk pace, and we had to hurry to keep up.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is frustrating, and their enthusiasm wanes.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: When a feeling of eager enjoyment, interest, or approval decreases in vigor or extent.

phase3Production.content: After several weeks of repetitive tasks, the volunteers' initial enthusiasm began to wane.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Meanwhile, the slowest ones are not only embarrassed but physically struggling to keep up.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having great difficulty with a physical task.

phase3Production.content: He was physically struggling to carry the heavy boxes up the stairs.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: bore students, frustrate parents and burn out teachers
lexicalItems.sourceContext: Mixed-ability classes bore students, frustrate parents and burn out teachers.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Làm học sinh chán, phụ huynh nản lòng và giáo viên kiệt sức

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /bɔː ˈstjuːdənts frʌˈstreɪt ˈpeərənts ənd bɜːn aʊt ˈtiːtʃəz/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To cause students to lose interest, make parents feel annoyed or helpless, and cause teachers to suffer from extreme physical or mental exhaustion.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm học sinh chán, phụ huynh nản lòng và giáo viên kiệt sức

phase3Production.content: A poorly designed curriculum can bore students, frustrate parents, and burn out teachers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The brightest ones will never summit Mount Qomolangma, and the stragglers won’t enjoy the lovely stroll in the park they are perhaps more suited to.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những người tụt lại phía sau

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: People in a group who move more slowly or fall behind the others.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những người tụt lại phía sau

phase3Production.content: The tour guide waited for the stragglers at the back of the group to catch up.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Individuals suffer at the demands of the collective, mediocrity prevails.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự tầm thường chiếm ưu thế

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The quality of being not very good becomes the dominant or most common state.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tầm thường chiếm ưu thế

phase3Production.content: In a system that doesn't reward excellence, mediocrity often prevails.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The current pedagogical paradigm is arguably that of constructivism, which emerged out of the work of psychologist Lev Vygotsky.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A typical example, pattern, or model of teaching and education.

phase3Production.content: The shift from rote memorization to critical thinking represents a change in the pedagogical paradigm.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The current pedagogical paradigm is arguably that of constructivism, which emerged out of the work of psychologist Lev Vygotsky.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A theory of learning that suggests humans construct knowledge and meaning from their experiences.

phase3Production.content: Constructivism emphasizes active learning, where students build their own understanding of the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In the 1930s, Vygotsky emphasised the importance of targeting a student’s specific ‘zone of proximal development’ (ZPD).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The difference between what a learner can do without help and what they can achieve with guidance and encouragement from a skilled partner.

phase3Production.content: A good teacher identifies each student's zone of proximal development to provide appropriate challenges.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and so on – and what they can achieve independently.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đạt được một cách độc lập

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To accomplish something successfully on one's own, without help.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đạt được một cách độc lập

phase3Production.content: The goal of education is to help students become learners who can achieve independently.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The purpose of teaching is to provide and then gradually remove this ‘scaffolding’ until they are autonomous.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A teaching method that involves a teacher providing temporary support to a student who is learning a new concept or skill; this support is gradually removed as the student becomes more competent.

phase3Production.content: The teacher used scaffolding by providing a writing frame for the students' first essay.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The purpose of teaching is to provide and then gradually remove this ‘scaffolding’ until they are autonomous.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To slowly take something away over a period of time.

phase3Production.content: As the child's confidence grew, the parents began to gradually remove the training wheels from the bike.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...until they are autonomous.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having the freedom to act independently; self-governing.

phase3Production.content: The goal is to raise children who will become responsible and autonomous adults.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If we accept this model, it follows that streaming students with similar ZPDs would be an efficient and effective solution.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Giải pháp hiệu quả và hữu hiệu

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A solution that works well, produces the desired results, and does so without wasting time or resources.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giải pháp hiệu quả và hữu hiệu

phase3Production.content: Using a database is an efficient and effective solution for managing large amounts of information.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And that forcing everyone on the same hike – regardless of aptitude – would be madness.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Without paying attention to a person's natural ability to do something.

phase3Production.content: The competition is open to everyone, regardless of age or aptitude.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Despite all this, there is limited empirical evidence to suggest that streaming results in better outcomes for students.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bằng chứng thực nghiệm hạn chế

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A small amount of evidence that is based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bằng chứng thực nghiệm hạn chế

phase3Production.content: There is limited empirical evidence to support the claim that this supplement improves memory.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...streaming results in better outcomes for students.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: More favorable or desirable results or consequences.

phase3Production.content: The new teaching method has led to significantly better outcomes for struggling students.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Professor John Hattie... notes that ‘tracking has minimal effects on learning outcomes’.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ảnh hưởng tối thiểu đến kết quả học tập

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very small or insignificant impact on the results of the educational process.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ảnh hưởng tối thiểu đến kết quả học tập

phase3Production.content: The study found that the new policy had only minimal effects on employee productivity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: What is more, streaming appears to significantly – and negatively – affect those students assigned to the lowest sets.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ảnh hưởng đáng kể và tiêu cực

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have a large and harmful impact on something or someone.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ảnh hưởng đáng kể và tiêu cực
relatedCollocates: have a major negative impact on

phase3Production.content: The factory closure will significantly and negatively affect the local economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: These students tend to have much higher representation of low socioeconomic class.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tầng lớp kinh tế xã hội thấp

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A social standing or class of people with low income, low educational attainment, and low-status occupations.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tầng lớp kinh tế xã hội thấp

phase3Production.content: Children from a low socioeconomic class often face more barriers to education.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Less significant is the small benefit for those lucky clever students in the higher sets.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A slight advantage or positive result for someone.

phase3Production.content: The new tax cut provides only a small benefit for low-income families.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: the smart stay smart and the dumb get dumber
lexicalItems.sourceContext: The overall result is that the smart stay smart and the dumb get dumber, further entrenching the social divide.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Người thông minh vẫn thông minh và người ngốc càng ngốc hơn

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /ðə smɑːt steɪ smɑːt ənd ðə dʌm ɡet ˈdʌmə/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom suggesting that a system reinforces existing advantages and disadvantages, widening the gap between high and low achievers.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người thông minh vẫn thông minh và người ngốc càng ngốc hơn

phase3Production.content: Critics argue that the new educational policy will just make the smart stay smart and the dumb get dumber.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...further entrenching the social divide.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Làm sâu sắc thêm sự phân chia xã hội

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To establish a social gap so firmly that it cannot be changed.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm sâu sắc thêm sự phân chia xã hội

verb.meaning: củng cố, làm cho ăn sâu

phase3Production.content: Unequal access to technology is at risk of further entrenching the social divide.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In the latest update of Hattie’s influential meta-analysis of factors influencing student achievement...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Phân tích tổng hợp có ảnh hưởng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A widely-regarded examination of data from a number of independent studies of the same subject, in order to determine overall trends.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phân tích tổng hợp có ảnh hưởng

phase3Production.content: The researcher conducted an influential meta-analysis that combined the results of over 100 different studies.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...factors influencing student achievement...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A measure of the knowledge, skills, and abilities that students have acquired through their education.

phase3Production.content: Teacher quality is one of the most important factors influencing student achievement.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...one of the most significant factors is the teachers’ estimate of achievement.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ước tính của giáo viên về thành tích

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A teacher's judgment or expectation of what a student is capable of accomplishing academically.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ước tính của giáo viên về thành tích

phase3Production.content: A high teachers' estimate of achievement can positively impact a student's performance.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Streaming students by diagnosed achievement automatically limits what the teacher feels the student is capable of.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A student's academic level as determined by a formal test or assessment.

phase3Production.content: Grouping by diagnosed achievement can lead to self-fulfilling prophecies in the classroom.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Meanwhile, in a mixed environment, teachers’ estimates need to be more diverse and flexible.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đa dạng và linh hoạt hơn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Showing a greater degree of variety and being more capable of changing or adapting.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đa dạng và linh hoạt hơn

phase3Production.content: To meet the needs of all learners, teaching methods must be more diverse and flexible.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: While streaming might seem to help teachers effectively target a student’s ZPD, it can underestimate the importance of peer-to-peer learning.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A learning method where students learn from and with each other without the immediate intervention of a teacher.

phase3Production.content: Group projects are an excellent way to encourage peer-to-peer learning in the classroom.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A crucial aspect of constructivist theory is the role of the MKO – ‘more-knowledgeable other’ – in knowledge construction.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The educational philosophy that learners construct their own understanding through experiences and interactions.

phase3Production.content: According to constructivist theory, knowledge is not passively received but actively built by the learner.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A crucial aspect of constructivist theory is the role of the MKO – ‘more-knowledgeable other’ – in knowledge construction.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Người khác có kiến thức hơn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In Vygotsky's theory, anyone who has a better understanding or a higher ability level than the learner, with respect to a particular task, process, or concept.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người khác có kiến thức hơn

phase3Production.content: A more-knowledgeable other can be a teacher, a parent, or even a peer who understands a concept better.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the role of the MKO – ‘more-knowledgeable other’ – in knowledge construction.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process by which learners actively build their own understanding and knowledge.

phase3Production.content: Collaborative projects are effective for social knowledge construction.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the value of knowledgeable student peers must not go unrecognised.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những bạn học có kiến thức

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Fellow students who have a good understanding or a higher ability level in a particular subject.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những bạn học có kiến thức

phase3Production.content: Struggling students can often learn effectively from their more knowledgeable student peers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the value of knowledgeable student peers must not go unrecognised.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To not be acknowledged, appreciated, or identified.

phase3Production.content: Her hard work and dedication should not go unrecognised by the company.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: They operate with different language tools and different social tools from teachers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hoạt động với các công cụ ngôn ngữ khác nhau

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To use different ways of speaking and communicating.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sử dụng các công cụ ngôn ngữ khác nhau

phase3Production.content: Teenagers often operate with different language tools, like slang, that adults may not understand.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...they possess similar cognitive structures to their struggling classmates.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sở hữu cấu trúc nhận thức tương tự

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have comparable mental frameworks for organizing and interpreting information.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sở hữu cấu trúc nhận thức tương tự

phase3Production.content: Because they are at a similar developmental stage, children often possess similar cognitive structures.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There is also something exciting about passing on skills and knowledge that you yourself have just mastered – a certain pride and zeal...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Niềm tự hào và lòng nhiệt thành

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A feeling of deep pleasure or satisfaction derived from one's own achievements, combined with great energy or enthusiasm.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Niềm tự hào và lòng nhiệt thành

phase3Production.content: She approached her new job with great pride and zeal.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a certain freshness to the interaction between ‘teacher’ and ‘learner’ that is often lost by the expert...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự tương tác giữa 'người dạy' và 'người học'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The communication and reciprocal action or influence between the one who imparts knowledge and the one who acquires it.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tương tác giữa 'người dạy' và 'người học'

phase3Production.content: Effective learning depends on a positive interaction between the 'teacher' and the 'learner'.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...for whom the steps are obvious and the joy of discovery forgotten.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The feeling of great pleasure and happiness that comes from finding or learning something for the first time.

phase3Production.content: A good science class should inspire a sense of wonder and the joy of discovery in students.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Having a variety of different abilities in a collaborative learning environment provides valuable resources for helping students meet their learning needs...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Môi trường học tập hợp tác

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An educational setting where students work together in groups to complete a task or learn a concept.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Môi trường học tập hợp tác

phase3Production.content: The new classroom was designed to foster a collaborative learning environment with movable desks and shared whiteboards.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...provides valuable resources for helping students meet their learning needs...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Assets or sources of help that are of great worth or use.

phase3Production.content: The school library and its experienced librarians are valuable resources for students.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...for helping students meet their learning needs, not to mention improving their communication and social skills.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đáp ứng nhu cầu học tập của họ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To satisfy the specific requirements that students have in order to learn effectively.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đáp ứng nhu cầu học tập của họ

phase3Production.content: Differentiated instruction is a strategy used to help meet the diverse learning needs of all students in a classroom.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And today, more than ever, we need the many to flourish – not just a few bright stars.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way, especially as the result of a particularly favorable environment.

phase3Production.content: Children tend to flourish in a supportive and encouraging environment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Once a year, I go on a hike with my class, a mixed bunch of students. It is challenging. The fittest students realise they need to encourage the reluctant.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: So as to cause harm to or neglect of someone or something else.

phase3Production.content: He focused on his career at the expense of his family life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The fittest students realise they need to encourage the reluctant.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Khuyến khích những người miễn cưỡng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To give support, confidence, or hope to those who are unwilling or hesitant to do something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khuyến khích những người miễn cưỡng

phase3Production.content: It's the coach's job to encourage the reluctant players and build their confidence.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There are lookouts who report back, and extra items to carry for others.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Người canh gác báo cáo lại

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person stationed to keep watch for danger or trouble and then provide information to the group.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người canh gác báo cáo lại

phase3Production.content: The ship had a lookout in the crow's nest to report back if they spotted land.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We make it – together.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To succeed in reaching a goal as a group through collective effort.

phase3Production.content: Despite the storm, the climbers supported each other and were able to make it to the summit together.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Picture this. It’s an English literature lesson in a UK school, and the teacher has just read an extract from Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet with a class of 15-year-olds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An expression used to ask someone to imagine a particular situation.

phase3Production.content: Picture this: a beautiful beach, a warm sun, and no emails to answer.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: For three students, even these literary demands are beyond them.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Vượt quá khả năng của họ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Too difficult for them to understand or deal with.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vượt quá khả năng của họ

phase3Production.content: The advanced physics concepts were completely beyond him.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: As a teacher myself, I’d think my lesson would be going rather well if the discussion went as described above.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To proceed in a fairly good or successful way.

phase3Production.content: Considering the bad weather, the outdoor event is going rather well.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But wouldn’t this kind of class work better if there weren’t such a huge gap between the top and the bottom?

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very large difference or disparity between two things or groups.

phase3Production.content: There is a huge gap between the rich and the poor in many countries.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The practice is intuitively appealing to almost every stakeholder.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person with an interest or concern in something, especially a business or an educational system (e.g., students, parents, teachers, administrators).

phase3Production.content: The company held a meeting with every stakeholder to discuss the new project.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The fittest in the group take the lead and set a brisk pace.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be in the first position; to be the leader.

phase3Production.content: She decided to take the lead in organizing the charity event.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: What’s worse, they never get a long enough break.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A period of rest that is of a sufficient duration.

phase3Production.content: After working for six months straight, I really need a long enough break to recharge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the stragglers won’t enjoy the lovely stroll in the park they are perhaps more suited to.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A pleasant and leisurely walk.

phase3Production.content: We went for a lovely stroll along the beach at sunset.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Individuals suffer at the demands of the collective, mediocrity prevails.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những yêu cầu của tập thể

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The needs or requirements of the group as a whole, often at the expense of the individual.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những yêu cầu của tập thể

phase3Production.content: In some societies, the demands of the collective are prioritized over individual freedoms.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: If we accept this model, it follows that streaming students with similar ZPDs would be an efficient and effective solution.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Used to say that something is the logical result of what has just been stated.

phase3Production.content: All the evidence points to him. It follows that he is the primary suspect.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And that forcing everyone on the same hike – regardless of aptitude – would be madness.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Would be a very foolish or crazy thing to do.

phase3Production.content: Trying to climb that mountain without the proper equipment would be madness.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: These students tend to have much higher representation of low socioeconomic class.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tỷ lệ đại diện cao hơn của

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A larger proportion or number of a particular group.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tỷ lệ đại diện cao hơn của

phase3Production.content: The new committee has a much higher representation of women than the previous one.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Less significant is the small benefit for those lucky clever students in the higher sets.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những học sinh thông minh may mắn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A slightly sarcastic or dismissive term for students who are both fortunate and intelligent.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những học sinh thông minh may mắn

phase3Production.content: The program was designed to challenge even the most lucky clever students.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Streaming students by diagnosed achievement automatically limits what the teacher feels the student is capable of.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To restrict something as a direct and unavoidable consequence, without conscious thought.

phase3Production.content: Having a small budget automatically limits the number of places you can travel to.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...what the teacher feels the student is capable of.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve a specified thing.

phase3Production.content: She is a talented musician who is capable of playing several instruments.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A crucial aspect of constructivist theory is the role of the MKO...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A point or feature that is of decisive importance.

phase3Production.content: Communication is a crucial aspect of any successful relationship.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: While teachers are traditionally the MKOs in classrooms, the value of knowledgeable student peers must not go unrecognised.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: According to the long-established customs or beliefs of a society.

phase3Production.content: The festival is traditionally held on the first weekend of May.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: I find it amazing to watch students get over an idea to their peers in ways that I would never think of.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To succeed in communicating an idea or concept to others.

phase3Production.content: He used a simple analogy to get over the complex idea to the audience.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: They operate with different language tools and different social tools from teachers...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The skills and methods used for communicating and interacting with others.

phase3Production.content: Empathy and active listening are important social tools for building strong relationships.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There is also something exciting about passing on skills and knowledge that you yourself have just mastered...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To teach someone skills that you have learned.

phase3Production.content: The master craftsman took great pride in passing on his skills to his apprentices.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a certain freshness to the interaction... that is often lost by the expert for whom the steps are obvious...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị mất đi bởi chuyên gia

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A quality that is no longer present in or possessed by someone with deep knowledge, often due to familiarity.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị mất đi bởi chuyên gia

phase3Production.content: The beginner's excitement is a feeling that is often lost by the expert who has done it a thousand times.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And today, more than ever, we need the many to flourish...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: More than at any time in the past.
relatedCollocates: more so than in the past

phase3Production.content: In this age of misinformation, critical thinking is needed more than ever.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we need the many to flourish – not just a few bright stars.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A small number of exceptionally talented or successful people.

phase3Production.content: A successful team relies on the contributions of all its members, not just a few bright stars.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Once a year, I go on a hike with my class, a mixed bunch of students.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một nhóm học sinh hỗn hợp

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A group of students with a variety of different characteristics, abilities, or backgrounds.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một nhóm học sinh hỗn hợp

phase3Production.content: The new project team is a mixed bunch of students from different faculties.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There are lookouts who report back, and extra items to carry for others.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To hold and transport items on behalf of other people, often as an act of help or support.

phase3Production.content: On the long trek, the stronger hikers offered to carry extra water for others in the group.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the teacher has just read an extract from Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet with a class of 15-year-olds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To read a short piece taken from a book, play, or piece of music.

phase3Production.content: For homework, the students were asked to read an extract from a famous historical speech.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He’s given some of the students copies of No Fear Shakespeare, a kid-friendly translation of the original.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bản dịch thân thiện với trẻ em

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A version of a text that has been adapted to be suitable and easy for children to understand.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bản dịch thân thiện với trẻ em

phase3Production.content: The museum offers a kid-friendly translation of the exhibit descriptions to engage younger visitors.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Another girl simply can’t focus and he gives her pens and paper to draw with.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đơn giản là không thể tập trung

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be completely unable to concentrate on a task.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đơn giản là không thể tập trung

phase3Production.content: With all the noise from the construction outside, I simply can't focus on my work.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He can ask the No Fear group to identify the key characters and provide a tentative plot summary.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The most important people in a story or play.

phase3Production.content: Understanding the motivations of the key characters is essential to understanding the novel.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He can ask most of the class about character development...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of creating a believable character in fiction by giving them depth and personality, and showing how they change over time.

phase3Production.content: The novel was praised for its complex plot and rich character development.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and comprehensive schools for the rest.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A type of secondary school that does not select its intake on the basis of academic achievement or aptitude.

phase3Production.content: In the UK, most students attend local comprehensive schools.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Within schools, it means selecting students into a ‘stream’ of general ability, or ‘sets’ of subject-specific ability.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Năng lực theo môn học cụ thể

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person's skill or aptitude in a particular academic subject.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Năng lực theo môn học cụ thể

phase3Production.content: A student might have a high general intelligence but a lower subject-specific ability in mathematics.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The fittest in the group take the lead and set a brisk pace.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The people who are in the best physical condition.

phase3Production.content: In the marathon, only the fittest runners were able to finish the race.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Meanwhile, the slowest ones are not only embarrassed but physically struggling to keep up.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To move or progress at the same rate as someone or something else.

phase3Production.content: The professor spoke so quickly that it was difficult to keep up with his lecture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The brightest ones will never summit Mount Qomolangma...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To reach the top of Mount Everest (Qomolangma is the Tibetan name). Used metaphorically for reaching the highest peak of achievement.

phase3Production.content: Only a few experienced climbers are able to summit Mount Qomolangma each year.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the stragglers won’t enjoy the lovely stroll in the park they are perhaps more suited to.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be more appropriate or a better fit for a particular purpose or person.

phase3Production.content: A career in nursing is more suited to people who are compassionate and patient.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The current pedagogical paradigm is arguably that of constructivism, which emerged out of the work of psychologist Lev Vygotsky.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To arise or come into being from a particular source or context.

phase3Production.content: The new art movement emerged out of the social and political turmoil of the 1960s.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is the gap between what they can achieve only with support – teachers, textbooks, worked examples, parents and so on – and what they can achieve independently.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các ví dụ đã được giải

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Step-by-step demonstrations of how to solve a problem, used as a learning aid.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các ví dụ đã được giải

phase3Production.content: The math textbook provides many worked examples to help students understand the formulas.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...affect those students assigned to the lowest sets.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được xếp vào các nhóm thấp nhất

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be placed in the classes or groups for students with the lowest academic ability.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được xếp vào các nhóm thấp nhất

phase3Production.content: He lost confidence in his math skills after being assigned to the lowest set.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...further entrenching the social divide.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A significant gap or separation between different groups in a society, especially based on wealth, class, or education.

phase3Production.content: The growing gap between the rich and the poor is widening the social divide.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it can underestimate the importance of peer-to-peer learning.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đánh giá thấp tầm quan trọng của

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fail to recognize how significant or valuable something is.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đánh giá thấp tầm quan trọng của

phase3Production.content: Never underestimate the importance of a good night's sleep.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...passing on skills and knowledge that you yourself have just mastered...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have very recently become proficient or skilled in something.

phase3Production.content: She was excited to teach her little brother a card trick she had just mastered.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a certain pride and zeal, a certain freshness to the interaction between ‘teacher’ and ‘learner’...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một sự tươi mới nhất định

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A particular quality of being new, original, or exciting.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một sự tươi mới nhất định

phase3Production.content: The young director brought a certain freshness to the classic play.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that is often lost by the expert for whom the steps are obvious and the joy of discovery forgotten.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: When the stages of a process are so clear and easy to understand (to someone) that they require no explanation.

phase3Production.content: For a professional chef, the steps to making a simple sauce are obvious.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...not to mention improving their communication and social skills.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Kỹ năng giao tiếp và xã hội

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The abilities used to communicate and interact with other people, both verbally and non-verbally.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kỹ năng giao tiếp và xã hội

phase3Production.content: Group projects help students develop important communication and social skills.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Once a year, I go on a hike with my class, a mixed bunch of students. It is challenging.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: It is difficult in a way that tests one's ability or determination.

phase3Production.content: Learning a new language is challenging, but also very rewarding.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There are lookouts who report back, and extra items to carry for others.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Additional things or objects.

phase3Production.content: When packing for the trip, remember to bring a few extra items like a flashlight and a first-aid kit.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...they possess similar cognitive structures to their struggling classmates.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những bạn học đang gặp khó khăn

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Fellow students who are experiencing difficulty in learning or keeping up.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những bạn học đang gặp khó khăn

phase3Production.content: She often stays after class to help her struggling classmates with their homework.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Once a year, I go on a hike with my class, a mixed bunch of students.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A group of people with a variety of different characters, abilities, or interests.

phase3Production.content: Our book club is a mixed bunch, with members of all ages and professions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The fittest students realise they need to encourage the reluctant.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The students who are in the best physical condition (used in the hiking analogy).

phase3Production.content: During sports day, the fittest students competed in the long-distance running events.
